{"step_by_step_thinking": "Li-Fraumeni syndrome is a rare, autosomal dominant, hereditary disorder that predisposes carriers to cancer development. It is not autosomal recessive. Autosomal recessive disorders require both copies of a gene to be mutated in order for the disorder to be present. In Li-Fraumeni syndrome, only one copy of the TP53 gene needs to be mutated for the disorder to occur. Therefore, the correct answer is no.", "answer_choice": "B"}
